intro: Echinospermum cristatum, commonly known as the crownflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a hairy, upright stem with opposite leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its most distinctive feature is its yellow-orange flower head, which consists of numerous small florets arranged in a radiate pattern. Echinospermum cristatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
